Talon:

Talon come close to help "You should  sit down and wait, help is cl=
ose"


From: Sandy 
Sent: Tuesday, January 19, 2010 10:43 AM
To: nbwrpg@yah=
oogroups.com 
Subject: Re: The Old Maximal Base/Unicron's come back


  
Tu=
cson fully agreed with Talon. He was feeling the effects even in vehicle mo=
de. Once transformed he could feel that it would be extremely difficult to =
transform back into robot mode. He decided that going back to robot mode wo=
uld be better, because there was a great chance that Lamia's venom had effe=
cted his transformation card.

With an even greater effort, he slowly gets =
back into robot mode, barely able to make the last phase of the transformat=
ion.

"Slag. That - wasn't a good idea. If - I remained in my alt form ther=
e - wouldn't have been any way to - access the correct circuitry for the - =
repairs."

There was no doubt about it, Lamia's venom was affecting him. Ye=
t, he didn't want to seem too helpless either. He finds the strength to get=
 on his knees and pauses there for a moment. At this time his processor was=
 spinning a million miles per second, as a wave of dizziness hits him with =
enough of a punch to knock him back down on his left side. He catches his f=
all. 

"Better - stand back Talon. I - don't want to fall on top of you." 
=

He gets back on his knees and this time, plants his left foot firmly on th=
e ground, and manages to hoist himself back up on two feet, yet using the w=
all to lean on to keep himself upright. By hell and high water he was going=
 to walk on that ramp on his own two feet.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, =
<airly2002@...> wrote:
>
> Talon:
> 
> "Dont do an excessive effort" said T=
alon "We dont know what that worm can do with her vemon" she opened a com l=
ink and said"Lord Persus, i need to speak with you... in private"
> 
> 
> F=
rom: Sandy 
> Sent: Friday, January 15, 2010 8:52 AM

ps.com

Tucson could not help but smile at Talon's complement. Even though his dama=
ges caused him slight pain, he did not want to come across as a bot with a =
low tolerance. The more he sat there, the more he began to get in touch wit=
h his sociable side. He could sense where Talon was, and is sure to put a g=
entile hand on her shoulder.
> 
> " Well, if it hadn't been for Kup's train=
ing, I don't think I'd be as skilled as I am. I sure do miss him. I can't r=
emember much about what really happened and how I got separated from the ot=
her Autobots. I know I was hit, and I got severely damaged by an unexpected=
 blow to my processor.. I wish I could remember where that blast came from =
and who it was from." 
> 
> He tries to get up but weakness takes its toll =
on him.
> 
> "Ughhh, yeah, that hit definitely took a lot out of me. Tell L=
ord Perseus that I'm going to need a little road side assistance. Let's see=
. I - think it's best that I try to transform, that way, it's easier to whe=
el me out of here. 
> 
> Slowly he manages to transform into his vehicle mo=
de and barely makes it as several metal plates shift with a bit of a lag.
>=
 
> " That's - better. Kup - warned me there'd be - days like this."
> 
> -=
